Text.Value: I've just remembered I need to be somewhere. But good luck with your hunt.
I wouldn't blame the vampire spawn - I hear they have to follow their master's orders.
I'm on a mission from the head of my tribe. She sent me here to capture the beast.
Attack.
Forgive the aroma. Powdered iron-vine - an old hunters' trick. Most monsters will think twice before making a meal of me.
Why should I believe anything you say?
I've met people like you before. You're a Gur, aren't you?
It'd make me think twice, certainly.
Believe or don't. It changes nothing about my mission. I'm hunting a vampire, you see.
It can't be. It's not possible.

EditorData.NodeContext: You see your prey in front of you - a vampire standing in the sunlight. After this line, it goes straight to combat.

Text.Value: Nothing so dramatic. I'm hunting for a vampire spawn.
I'm on a mission from the head of my tribe. She sent me here to capture the beast.
I hope so. Anything that discourages a bite. I'm hunting a vampire, you see.
I am hoping the hag of these lands can help me. If I could afford her price.

EditorData.NodeContext: He knows her price will be high - not just financially, it'll cost him something dear to him.

Text.Value: Leave.
Why not just kill him?
My people were recently attacked in the night - our camp set upon by a band of vampire spawn.
Forgive the aroma. Powdered iron-vine - an old hunters' trick. Most monsters will think twice before making a meal of me.
Well, you stink. I'm sure that'll protect you.
Oh? What are you hunting?
As much as I'd like to, no.
*You catch a waft of something foul - metallic and sickly-sweet.*
Funny. I thought your people were all cut-throats, not monster hunters.
Not just cut-throats! We're thieves, con artists, vagrants - the list goes on.

EditorData.NodeContext: Joking in response to your stereotype of his people

Text.Value: *You catch a waft of something foul - metallic and sickly-sweet.*
A vile little creature: a vampire spawn named Astarion.
And when you find him? Will you kill this Astarion?
I am to return him to Baldur's Gate alive. Or as close to 'alive' as a vampire gets.
And what is your prey exactly? Dragon? Cyclops? Kobold?

EditorData.NodeContext: Dragon and cyclops are huge and impressive, kobold is a runty little lizard creature.

Text.Value: I'm feeling a little ill, actually. I should go.
...What do you know of this creature?
Guilty. My people are wanderers - we travel across Faern, doing what good we can, where we can.
In the chaos of battle, one of them stole away with our children. We have been searching for them ever since.
I wish I had half the power you settled folk think my people possess. Alas, I am a simple wanderer, on the hunt.
Well, not a true vampire. A spawn named Astarion.

EditorData.NodeContext: A vampire spawn isn't a 'real' vampire after all.

Text.Value: I had hoped the hag of these lands could help me, but it seems she is no more. For the best, perhaps.

EditorData.NodeContext: The hag is dead. She could have been useful, but she was a monster. He has mixed feelings about her being killed.

Text.Value: I've been hunting at night, but not found any trace of my prey.
Oh, I know everything about him.

EditorData.NodeContext: bares fangs in response to 'what do you know of this creature?'

Text.Value: A - Why?

EditorData.NodeContext: is going to say 'a vampire spawn??' in shock, but catches himself.

Text.Value: I seek only one evil: a vampire spawn named Astarion.
How do you plan to find him?
Here, I will rid this land of a wicked evil. A beast that prowls the night.
You're in the right place - there's plenty of evil here.
Of course. Be safe on your travels.
I fear it is needed. I am hunting a wicked evil. A beast that prowls the night.
And good luck to you, my friend. Be safe.
You're a monster hunter? I'm surprised - I thought all Gur were wandering cut-throats.
Attack.
No - it can't be.

EditorData.NodeContext: Astarion - a vampire -is standing in front of you in broad daylight. After this line, you immediately go into combat.

Text.Value: And return him to Baldur's Gate, no doubt?

EditorData.NodeContext: Darkly. Astarion realises he'll have to kill this hunter.

Text.Value: Are you all right, my friend? You look a little pale.

EditorData.NodeContext: Noticed the look of shock on Astarion's face.

Text.Value: He cannot hide forever, though. I will catch him and return him to Baldur's Gate.
Well done! You found him.
Monsters are monsters. And whatever his reasons, the monster still knows where our children are.
*You remember the night well. The shouts of battle, the screams of the children as you dragged them away...*
We believe this Astarion knows exactly what happened that night, and where to find our little ones.

Synopsis: Astarion meets a Gur Hunter that reveals he's hunting a vampire spawn - Astarion himself, although the hunter doesn't realise this. Astarion starts with a mocking tone, but once he realises the hunter's purpose he tries to get some information before leaving or killing the hunter.
